UI_visible_response: Read 22 web pagesView Page DetailsThe term "Cyber Berlin Wall" is a metaphorical reference to the creation of digital barriers that restrict or control the flow of information on the internet, similar to how the physical Berlin Wall restricted movement between East and West Berlin during the Cold War. This concept is often used to describe the global spread of online censorship laws and practices that are modeled after Germany's Network Enforcement Act (NetzDG), which requires social media platforms to remove illegal content within specified time limits. The NetzDG has been criticized for potentially limiting free speech and has served as a template for similar laws in other countries, some of which have more authoritarian regimes. This has led to concerns that such laws could be used to suppress dissent and control public discourse, thus creating a "Cyber Berlin Wall" that divides the internet and restricts the free flow of information.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: The term "Cyber Berlin Wall" is a metaphorical reference to the creation of digital barriers that restrict or control the flow of information on the internet, similar to how the physical Berlin Wall restricted movement between East and West Berlin during the Cold War[^4^]. This concept is often used to describe the global spread of online censorship laws and practices that are modeled after Germany's Network Enforcement Act (NetzDG), which requires social media platforms to remove illegal content within specified time limits[^2^]. The NetzDG has been criticized for potentially limiting free speech and has served as a template for similar laws in other countries, some of which have more authoritarian regimes[^2^]. This has led to concerns that such laws could be used to suppress dissent and control public discourse, thus creating a "Cyber Berlin Wall" that divides the internet and restricts the free flow of information[^2^].
